negotiator.protocol

Interface Protocol

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AlternatingOfferConsensusProtocol, AlternatingOfferCounterOfferProtocol, AlternatingOfferMajorityVotingProtocol, MediatorFeedbackProtocol, MediatorProtocol, ProtocolAdapter, SimpleMediatorBasedProtocol

    public interface Protocol
    This interface defines a protocol that should be executed by the SessionManager. There also exists an ProtocolAdapter which implements all the methods in this interface with default values. *

    For some examples on Alternating offer protocols, please refer to: AlternatingOfferConsensusProtocol AlternatingOfferCounterOfferProtocol AlternatingOfferMajorityVotingProtocol

    For an example on Mediator protocols, please refer to: MediatorProtocol

    • Method Detail

      • getRoundStructure

        Round getRoundStructure(java.util.List<NegotiationParty> parties,
                      Session session)
        Get the structure of the current round. Each round, this method receives a list of all the NegotiationParty and the complete Session which can be used to diversify the round structure at some point during the session.
        Parameters:
        parties - The parties currently participating
        session - The complete session history
        Returns:
        A list of possible actions

      • beforeSession

        void beforeSession(Session session,
                 java.util.List<NegotiationParty> parties)
        This will get called just before the session starts. If some initialization needs to be done by the protocol, it can be done here.
        Parameters:
        session - The session instance that will be used for the session
        parties - The parties that will participate in the session

      • afterSession

        void afterSession(Session session,
                java.util.List<NegotiationParty> parties)
        This will get called just after ending the session. If the protocol needs to do some post session steps, it can be done here.
        Parameters:
        session - The session instance that was used for the session
        parties - The parties that participated in the session

      • applyAction

        void applyAction(Action action,
               Session session)
        Apply the action according to the protocol. All actions done by all agents come through this method. If protocol needs to adapt anything according to actions, it can be handled here.
        Parameters:
        action - action to apply
        session - the current state of this session

      • isFinished

        boolean isFinished(Session session,
                 java.util.List<NegotiationParty> parties)
        Check if the protocol is done or still busy. If this method returns true, the SessionManager will not start a new Round after the current one. It will however finish all the turns described in the getRoundStructure(java.util.List, negotiator.session.Session) method.
        Parameters:
        session - the current state of this session
        Returns:
        true if the protocol is finished

      • getActionListeners

        java.util.Map<NegotiationParty,java.util.List<NegotiationParty>> getActionListeners(java.util.List<NegotiationParty> parties)
        Get a map of parties that are listening to each other's response
        Parameters:
        parties - The parties involved in the current negotiation
        Returns:
        A map where the key is a NegotiationParty that is responding to a NegotiationParty.chooseAction(List) event, and the value is a list of NegotiationPartys that are listening to that key party's response.

      • getCurrentAgreement

        Bid getCurrentAgreement(Session session,
                      java.util.List<NegotiationParty> parties)
        This method should return the current agreement.

        Some protocols only have an agreement at the negotiation session, make sure that this method returns null until the end of the session in that case, because this method might be queried at intermediary steps.

        Parameters:
        session - The complete session history up to this point
        parties - The parties involved in the current negotiation
        Returns:
        The agreed upon bid or null if no agreement

      • getNumberOfAgreeingParties

        int getNumberOfAgreeingParties(Session session,
                             java.util.List<NegotiationParty> parties)
        Gets the number of parties that currently agree to the offer. For protocols that either have an agreement or not, you can set this number to 0 until an agreement is found, and then set this value to the number of parties.
        Parameters:
        session - the current state of this session
        parties - The parties currently participating
        Returns:
        the number of parties agreeing to the current agreement
